SIMPLEX PISTON RING COMPANY OF AMERICA, Inc., Plaintiff Appellee, v. Arden L. HAMILTON, Individually and Doing Business under the Name and Style of Hamilton Motor Parts Company, Defendant Appellant. Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. April 9, 1928. No. 224. Emanuel Celler, of New York City (W. Lee Helms, of New York City, of counsel), for appellant. Gifford & Scull, of New York City (A. C. Paul, of Minneapolis, Minn., C. B. Belknap, of Detroit, Mich., and Newton A. Burgess, of New York City, of counsel), for appellee.

Before MANTON, L. HAND, and AUGUSTUS N. HAND, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

Decree (21 F.[2d] 196) affirmed.
